question: When a vehicle changes lane, the driver should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe traffic conditions, maintain a safe distance and move into the new lane.
When a vehicle changes lane before an intersection, the driver should turn on the turn signal and change lane after entering the area marked by solid lines.
When a vehicle changes to the right lane, the driver should turn on the right-turn signal in advance, observe and enter the new lane if it is safe to do so.
When a vehicle changes lane, the driver only needs to turn on the turn signal before rapidly entering the new lane.

When a vehicle merges with the traffic flow, the driver should turn on the turn signal in advance, go straight, observe the traffic conditions on both sides through the rear-view mirror, and merge with the traffic flow if it is safe to do so.
When a vehicle changes lane, the driver should turn on the turn signal and rapidly enter the new lane.
Before a vehicle merges into the traffic flow from another road, the driver should observe the traffic conditions beside and behind the vehicle.
When a vehicle passes a crosswalk, the driver should yield to the pedestrians.
When a vehicle approaches a crosswalk, it should try to pass from behind the pedestrians if pedestrians are cross the street.
When a vehicle is ready to start up after a temporary stopping, the driver should honk to notify the vehicles in the left lane.
When a vehicle starts up, the driver should observe the traffic conditions and begin to start up after making sure it is safe to do so.
A vehicle should try to speed up after starting from the roadside and rapidly turn left into the traffic flow on the road.
After a vehicle starts from the roadside, the driver should pay close attention to the traffic conditions on both sides, turn left slowly and gradually join the traffic flow on the road.
When reversing, the driver should carefully observe the reversing line and make sure it is safe to reverse before reversing.
In the course of reversing, the driver should carefully observe the space on both sides of the front so as to avoid scratching arising from an unduly large turning angle.
In the course of reversing, the driver should move slowly, observe the conditions on both sides and in the rear and be ready to stop anytime.
When reversing, the driver should speed up and reverse and complete the operation rapidly if the road conditions behind the vehicle are good.

When running on a road with a broken central line, the vehicles should go in their respective lanes and are not allowed to cross the central line when there are vehicles coming in the opposite direction.
If a vehicle may encounter a vehicle coming in the opposite direction in the course of overtaking, the driver should speed up in advance and overtake.
When a vehicle passes a tunnel, it is prohibited from overtaking.
When a vehicle passes a level crossing, it is prohibited from overtaking.
When a vehicle passes a sharp curve, it may overtake if traffic is light.
When a vehicle passes a narrow road or bridge, it is prohibited from overtaking.
When there is another vehicle making a U turn on the road ahead, the driver should overtake rapidly while that vehicle is in the course of stopping and gear shifting.
When another vehicle is overtaking, the driver should speed up and do not allow that vehicle to overtake.
When another vehicle is overtaking, the driver is not allowed to turn left or apply emergency braking so as to avoid rear-end or side collision due to the slow reaction of that vehicle.
When a vehicles turns, it should do so on the right side and refrain from occupying the lane of the other party. The left turn should be gentle and the right turn should be sharp.
When vehicles make a gentle turn, the vehicles in the outer turning lane may use the lane for vehicles coming in the opposite direction.
Before a vehicle enters an intersection, the driver should reduce speed, observe and make sure it is safe to do so.
When passing an intersection, the vehicles in the fast lane may not change lane for a right turn.
When passing a level crossing, the vehicles should not enter the crossing even if the traffic signal allows them to do so if there is a congestion ahead.
When a vehicle passes a level crossing, the driver should use the low gear to pass and should not change gear halfway in order to avoid engine kill.
When passing an unmanned level crossing, the driver may speed up and pass if he sees no train is coming.
When passing a manned level crossing, the driver should obey to the command of the crossing manager and refrain from competing with the train.
Before a vehicle enters a roundabout, the driver should turn on the right-turn signal.
If discovering pedestrians abruptly cross the road while driving, the driver should immediately reduce speed and evade.
When encountering pedestrians wearing cotton-padded caps or overcoats in winter, the driver should honk and be ready to brake.
When encountering people carrying load on shoulder poles or carrying farm tools on shoulders, the driver should observe their movement, control speed and pass by keeping a sufficient safe distance.
When the pedestrians are violating the traffic regulations, the vehicles may not yield to the pedestrians.
After the green light at an intersection is on, the vehicles may not yield if non-motorized vehicles cut in.
When animals abruptly cross a road, the driver should evade if it is safe for the passengers and goods in the vehicle.
When animals cross a road and impede the traffic, the driver may continuously honk to drive them away.
When discovering another vehicle running abnormally, the driver should voluntarily evade to avoid a traffic accident.
When a pedestrian deliberately refuses to yield to the vehicle, the driver may continuously honk and pass.
When making a U turn, the driver should observe whether there is a "no U turn" sign and should never make a U turn at a place where U turn is prohibited.
The vehicles may make U turns in a dangerous section with care.

Before a vehicle makes a U turn, the driver should first observe the traffic conditions behind the vehicle. When advancing or reversing in the course of making a U turn, he should observe the traffic conditions before and behind the vehicle.

In the course of making a U turn, the driver should strictly control the speed, carefully observe the road conditions before and behind the vehicle, and may advance or reverse only if it is safe to do so.
When making a U turn on a slope, the foot brake instead of the handbrake should be used for each stopping.
When encountering a "watch for children" sign, the driver should speed up and pass in case the children abruptly cross the road.
When encountering children playing on the highway, the driver should continuously honk, speed up and pass.
When encountering children play on the roadside, the driver should reduce speed in advance and pass with care.
When encountering old people walking on the road and obstructing the traffic, the driver may continuously honk to urge them to yield.
When encountering slow-moving old people crossing the road, the driver may continuously honk to urge them.
When encountering blind people or other pedestrians who have difficulty moving about, the driver should reduce speed, go slowly, and stop when necessary.
When encountering disabled people obstructing the traffic, the driver should voluntarily reduce speed and yield.
When encountering pedestrians who lack traffic experience, the driver should watch out, control the speed and be ready to stop or yield anytime.
In a vehicle that has safety belts, the driver should request the passengers to buckle up.
In a traffic accident, the driver should first protect him and then protect the passengers in the vehicle.
When encountering somebody herding animals and obstructing the traffic, the driver should continuously honk to warn.
When encountering somebody herding animals crossing the road or going in the same direction, the driver may continuously honk to urge him to yield.
When bicycles ahead obstruct the traffic flow, the driver may honk to remind them, speed up and bypass.
When braking or stopping after overtaking a man-powered cart on a down slope, the driver should leave a sufficient safe distance for the cart.
When an animal-drawn cart cuts in on the road, the driver should honk to warn in a timely manner.
When a motorized vehicle encounters the cut in by another vehicle in a roundabout, the driver may not evade as long as he has the right of way.
When reaching an intersection, a left-turning vehicle may enter the left-turn waiting area anytime.
When reaching a sharp curve, the driver should reduce speed and drive on the right side so as to avoid colliding with the vehicle crossing the central line of the curve in the opposite direction.
When driving in continuous curves, the driver should try to go along the inner side of the curves.
When encountering a vehicle that has the right of way, the driver should voluntarily yield.
When stopping on the road, the driver should select a section where stopping is allowed and should park the car on the right side of the road in the coming direction.
When a vehicle temporarily stops at the roadside, the driver may stop the vehicle in the opposite direction or in parallel.
When a vehicle stops for a long time, the driver should select a car park to do so.
When a vehicle passes a school or a residential area, the driver should observe the signs and markings, go slowly and refrain from honking.
When entering an expressway toll gate, the driver should select a gate where _______.
After entering an expressway ramp, the vehicle _________.

options.b: Is prohibited from making a U turn

question: After entering the acceleration lane of an expressway, the driver should increase the speed to more than _________ per hour.
After entering the acceleration lane of an expressway and when the traffic in the carriageway is light, the driver may _______.

options.a: Enter the carriageway behind the normally running vehicles
options.b: Enter the carriageway before the normally running vehicles
options.c: Stop and wait for the passing of the normally running vehicles
options.d: Speed up and directly enter the carriageway

question: When running on an expressway that has three lanes in the same direction, the vehicles whose speed ranges between 90 kilometers per hour and 110 kilometers per hour should run _________.
When running on an expressway that has four lanes in the same direction, the vehicles whose speed is higher than 110 kilometers per hour should run ______.
When running on an expressway that has four lanes in the same direction, the vehicles whose speed is lower than 80 kilometers per hour should run ______.
When running on expressway that has three lanes in the same direction, the minimum speed on the far right lane is _____ per hour.
When overtaking on an expressway, the minimum horizontal distance between vehicles should be ______ if the speed is 100 kilometers per hour.
The distance-ascertaining section of an expressway is used for the drivers to ascertain the safe distance when the speed is ______ per hour.
When a vehicle runs on an expressway at the speed of 100 kilometers per hour, the safe distance is _______.
When a vehicle runs on an expressway at the speed of 100 kilometers per hour, the dangerous distance between vehicles is _______.

The best chance to leave the carriageway of an expressway is _______ ahead of an exit. The driver should turn on the right-turn signal, properly adjust the speed and smoothly enters the deceleration lane.
When running on an expressway, the driver should ____ if he has missed the exit.

options.b: Continue to go ahead and find the next exit
options.d: Make a U turn from where he is

question: When a vehicle has to stop on an expressway due to a vehicle trouble, the driver should place a breakdown warning sign ______ behind the vehicle, and should turn on the contour light and tail light at night.
After a vehicle enters the deceleration lane of an expressway, the driver should turn off the turn signal, look at the speedometer, and reduce the speed to less than ______ before entering the ramp.

options.a: The speed specified in the sign

question: When a vehicle leaves the opening of an expressway tunnel, it will be attacked by side wind and the vehicle can have _____.
After a vehicle enters the ramp, the driver should swiftly increase the speed to more than 60 kilometers per hour.
A vehicle may stop on the ramp of an expressway.
A vehicle is not allowed to make a U turn on the ramp of an expressway.
A vehicle is not allowed to reverse on the ramp of an expressway.
When a vehicle has increased its speed to more than 60 kilometers per hour on the ramp of an expressway, it may directly enter the carriageway.
When discovering the normally running vehicles are following each other fairly closely on an expressway, the driver should find chance and cut in between them.
When running on an expressway that has two lanes in the same direction, the vehicle whose speed is lower than 100 kilometers per hour should run in the left lane.
The vehicles should run by the right shoulder of an expressway.
The safe distance ascertaining section of an expressway is used to ascertain the safe distance for the vehicles running at 100 kilometers per hour.
When a vehicle runs on an expressway at the speed of 100 kilometers per hour, its safe distance is more than 100 meters.
A vehicle running on an expressway may frequently change lanes.
If a vehicle running on an expressway misses an exit, it may reverse to the exit along the shoulder.
When a vehicle leaves an expressway, it should reduce speed in the deceleration lane before entering the ramp.
When a vehicle runs on an expressway, the driver may ascertain the speed according to his feeling.
After a vehicle enters the ramp from an expressway, it should reduce its speed below the prescribed speed limit.

When changing lanes on an expressway, the driver should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the traffic conditions, and slowly turn the steering wheel and enter the new lane after making sure it is safe to do so.

When driving on an expressway with a visibility of less than 100 meters, the driver should limit the speed below 40 kilometers per hour and should keep a distance of more than 50 meters from the vehicle in front.
When an accident has caused congestion on an expressway, the vehicles may run in the emergency strip on the right or in the shoulder of the road.
When a vehicle follows another vehicle on a mountain road, it should ____.

options.a: Closely follow the vehicle in front
options.d: Try to find a chance to overtake

question: When a vehicle stops halfway on a slope following another vehicle, the vehicle should keep _______ from the vehicle in front.

options.a: The same distance as on a level road
options.b: A smaller distance than on a level road
options.c: A distance half of that on a level road
options.d: A larger distance than on a level road

question: When overtaking on a mountain road, the vehicle should overtake ______.

options.a: By selecting a relatively gentle downhill section
options.c: By selecting a wide gentle uphill section
options.d: By selecting a fairly long downhill section

question: When encountering a vehicle coming in the opposite direction on a mountain road, the driver should ______ when crossing each other.

options.b: Stick to the center of the road
options.d: Select a safe section to reduce speed or stop

question: When stopping halfway on a downhill road, the brake pedal should be depressed ______.

options.a: Earlier than on a level road
options.b: Later than on a level road
options.c: As timely as on a level road
options.d: More gently than on a level road

question: When driving on a long downhill road, the speed can become faster and faster under inertia and the best way to control the speed is _______.

options.a: Shift to the neutral gear and slide
options.d: Use the foot brake to control the speed

question: Continuously using the foot brake on a long downhill road ________.

options.a: Can shorten the engine's service life
options.c: Can drastically reduce the braking efficiency due to the rising temperature of the brake

question: When a vehicle runs on a narrow mountain road, the driver should ______ if the party close to the mountain mass refuses to yield.

options.a: Use the left lane and pass with care
options.b: Reduce speed and select a safe place to evade
options.d: Honk to urge the other party to yield

question: When a vehicle goes uphill, the driver should observe the road conditions and the length of the slope in advance and shift to the lower gear in a timely manner to ensure the vehicle has sufficient power.
When a vehicle goes downhill, the driver should properly control the speed and fully use the engine to brake.
When a vehicle goes down a long slope, it should run at a lower gear and fully use the engine to brake.
When a vehicle goes downhill, it may fully use the neutral gear and slide.
When a vehicle passes a curve on a mountain road, the driver should reduce speed, honk and stick to the right.
When a vehicle goes downhill on a mountain road, it is not allowed to overtake.
When a vehicle goes uphill on a mountain road, it should change to the lower gear in advance, speed up and dash uphill.
When a vehicle follows another vehicle on a mountain road, it should properly reduce the safe distance.

After a vehicle enters a mountain road, it should pay special attention to the "continuous curves) sign. In addition, it should voluntarily evade vehicles and pedestrians, reduce speed in a time manner and honk in advance.

When a vehicle goes uphill on a mountain road, it should change to a lower gear in a timely, accurate and rapid manner so as to avoid a situation in which driving at a high gear can reduce the power of the engine.
When passing a dangerous section of a mountain road, the driver should drive with care and avoid stopping.
When passing a section of a mountain road which is prone to landside and mudflow, the driver should not stop.
When a vehicle reaches the opening of a tunnel allowing one-way passage and discovers another vehicle coming in the opposite direction, the driver should ________.

options.b: Move to the right side in the tunnel and stop to yield
options.c: Move to the right side outside the tunnel and stop to yield
options.d: Maintain the normal speed and pass

question: When a vehicle enters a two-way tunnel, the driver should turn on ________.

options.d: The width light or the low beam light

question: When a vehicle turns left through an interchange, the driver should ______.

options.a: First observe the traffic signs and then go forward as guided by the markings
options.b: First observe the markings and then go forward as guided by the traffic lights
options.c: Not observe the signs and markings and should turn right first before passing the interchange
options.d: Not observe the signs and markings and should look for the exit after entering the interchange

question: When a vehicle passing through an interchange discovers it has chosen a wrong route, it should immediately make a U turn from where it is or reverse to change route.
When a vehicle's load exceeds the weight permitted by the bridge weight-limit sign, it should pass slowly.
As the traffic flow at an interchange is generally one-way, the vehicles do not have to reduce speed when passing.
When a vehicle turns right through an interchange, it should pass the interchange before turning right.
When a vehicle turns left through an interchange, it should turn right and turn right again before passing the interchange.
When a vehicle turn left through an interchange, it should pass the interchange before turning right, entering the ramp and turning right again.
When driving at night on a road that has no lighting, the driver may use _____ and the light must reach over 30 meters away if the speed is less than 30 kilometers per hour.
When driving at night on a road that has no lighting, the driver may use ______ and the light must reach over 100 meters away if the speed exceeds 30 kilometers per hour.
When driving at night on a road that has good lighting, the driver should use _______.
When driving at night, there could be a sharp curve or a big hole ahead if the lighting _______.
When a vehicle running at night reaches the top of a slope, its lighting _______.

options.a: Moves from the center of the road to the roadside
options.b: Moves from the roadside to the center of the road

question: When a vehicle running at night encounters a curve ahead, its lighting ____.

options.d: Moves from the center of the road to the roadside

question: When vehicles cross each other at night, the drivers should not look straight to the light from the vehicle coming in the opposite direction. Instead, he should move his sight _______.

options.a: To the right side and go forward at a lower speed
options.b: To the left side and go forward at a lower speed
options.c: To the right side and maintain the normal speed
options.d: To the left side and go forward at a higher speed

question: When overtaking at night, the driver should _______, and overtake only after making sure the vehicle in front has reduced speed and yield.

options.a: Turn on the high beam light
options.b: Continuously switch the high and low beam lights
options.c: Turn on the low beam light

question: When crossing another vehicle at night, the driver should change to the low beam light _____ from the vehicle coming in the opposite direction.
When crossing a non-motorized vehicle on a narrow road or bridge, the driver should use ________.
When driving at night, the vehicle light covers a small scope and the driver's view is limited if compared with driving in the daytime.
When driving at night, the driver's observation ability is visibly poorer and his visibility range becomes shorter than driving in the daytime.
When driving at night, the driver does not easily have visual fatigue.
When driving at night, the driver should go at a lower speed because his field of vision is limited and he can hardly observe the traffic conditions beyond the area covered by his vehicle light.

When vehicles cross each other, the light from the vehicle in the opposite direction can dazzle the driver and make it impossible for him to clearly see the traffic conditions ahead. Therefore, the driver should move his sight to the right side to evade the light from that vehicle and should go forward at a lower speed.
When a vehicle starts to move, the driver should first turn on the low beam light.
When following a vehicle, the following vehicle may use the high beam light.

When the vehicles cross each other at night, the driver may continuous change lights to remind the vehicle coming in the opposite direction and at the same should reduce speed and go forward or stop on the right side.
When driving at night, the driver should try as much as possible to avoid overtaking. When he really needs to overtake, he may switch the high and low beam lights to alert the vehicle in front.
When driving at night, the driver should use the high beam light if his vehicle runs at a speed of less than 30 kilometers per hour.
When driving at night on a road with poor lighting, the driver should use the low beam light if his vehicle runs at a speed of more than 30 kilometers per hour.

When driving at night on a road with no or poor lighting, the driver should switch from the low beam light to the high beam light. But the vehicle following in the same direction is not allowed to use the high beam light.

When driving at night, the driver should reduce speed and go forward if the vehicle coming in the opposite direction fails to turn off the high beam light. This is designed to prevent an accident from happening when there are pedestrians crossing the place where the lights of the two vehicles meet.
When driving at night, the driver should speed up and pass if the vehicle coming in the opposite direction fails to turn off the high beam light.
When driving at night in windy, snowy, rainy and foggy weather conditions, the driver should use the fog light or the dazzle-free low beam light.
When passing a level crossing without traffic signals at night, the driver is not allowed to change the high and low beam lights.
When driving at night, the driver should reduce speed or stop to yield if the vehicle coming in the opposite direction fails to turn off the high beam light.
In a rainy day, the vertical distance between vehicles should be _______ longer than on a dry road.
When driving in a rainstorm and the windscreen wiper cannot totally wipe off the rain water, the driver should ________.

options.b: Concentrate his attention and drive with care
options.c: Immediately reduce speed and stop at the road side

question: In an icy and snowy day, the vertical distance between vehicles should be _______ longer than on a dry road.
When reducing speed or stopping on a road covered by ice and snow, the driver should fully use _______ to reduce the speed.
When driving in a snowy day, the driver should ________ in order to prevent side skidding or scratching other vehicles.

options.a: Reduce speed and maintain a safe distance
options.b: Closely follow the vehicle in front and honk to remind it
options.c: Keep a fairly small distance with the vehicle in front
options.d: Keep a fairly small horizontal distance with the vehicles in the neighboring lane

question: When vehicles cross each other on an icy road, the driver should ________, firmly hold the steering wheel and cross slowly.
When driving on a mountain road covered by ice and snow, the vehicle behind should ______ if the vehicle in front is climbing a slope.

options.a: Select a proper place to stop and climb after the vehicle in front has passed
options.b: Rapidly overtake the vehicle in front

question: When driving in a foggy day, the driver should turn on ______.
When driving in a foggy day, the driver should closely observe the movements of the pedestrians and other vehicles due to poor visibility and ______.

options.c: Turn on the high beam light

question: When driving in thick or extremely thick fog, the driver should ____ due to low visibility.

options.b: Turn on the contour light and fog light

question: When driving on a muddy road, the driver should select the proper gear, _____ to control the speed, and pass at an even speed without stopping.
When driving on a muddy road, the driver should _______ if the wheels of his vehicle spin.

options.a: Remove the muddy and cover with sands, rocks, grasses or wood

question: When driving in a strong wind, the driver must _______ and reduce speed if he feels the steering wheel "is suddenly deprived" due to the frequent changes in the speed and direction of the wind.

options.a: Turn the steering wheel in the direction against the wind
options.b: Turn the steering wheel in the direction with the wind
options.d: Firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands

question: When a vehicle wades across the water, the driver should maintain a low speed, and _____ the brake pedal so as to restore the braking efficiency.
When a vehicle passes a construction section, the driver should _______.

options.a: Select a proper place to stop
options.b: Bypass according to the directional signs
options.c: Pass slowly on the right side
options.d: Reduce speed and go on the left side

question: When a vehicle breaks down in a level crossing and is unable to move on, the driver should _______.

options.b: Manage to move the vehicle out of the crossing as fast as possible
options.c: Stay in the vehicle and wait for help
options.d: Get off the vehicle and wait for help

question: When driving in windy, rainy, snowy, foggy and other complex weather conditions, the driver should turn on the head light, honk continuously and overtake rapidly if the vehicle in front goes slowly.
As the braking distance increases on a wet road in a rainy day, the driver should use the emergency brake as much as possible to reduce speed.
When driving on an ordinary road in a foggy day, the driver should turn on the fog light and the high beam light simultaneously.
When driving in a foggy day, the driver should use the horn as less as possible or does not use it at all.
When driving in a heavy rain, the driver should control the speed to avoid the danger arising from "water slide".
As thick fog reduces visibility, turning on the high beam light can increase the visibility.

When there is a continuous rain, the shoulders of the mountain roads may become loose and the embankments may collapse. When driving in this weather, the driver should select the middle solid road and refrain from going close to the roadsides.
Honking in a foggy day can arouse the attention of the opposite side. After hearing the honking from the opposite side, the driver should also honk to respond.
When driving in a strong wind, the driver should abruptly turn the steering wheel to return to the original direction if he feels the vehicle deviates horizontally when hit by a fierce gale.
When driving on a road covered by ice and snow, the driver must reduce speed and increase the safe distance.
When driving in a snowy day, the driver should drive along the vehicle tracks if there are any.
Emergency braking on a road covered by ice and snow can easily cause side skidding. The driver should use the engine braking to reduce speed.
Emergency braking should not be used to deal with unexpected situations on the road covered by ice and snow. But sudden turning can be used to evade.
When vehicles encounter a slope on a low-grade mountain road covered by ice and snow, the vehicle going downhill should yield to the one going uphill.
When driving in a foggy day, the driver should use the horn more so as to arouse the attention of the opposite side.
When hearing a honking from the vehicle coming in the opposite direction in thick fog, the driver should honk in time to respond.
When a vehicle goes on a road covered by ice and snow, the driver should reduce speed and shorten the distance from the vehicle in front.
When a vehicles reaches a muddy or burst-and-muddy section, the driver should stop, observe and select the level and solid section or the section with vehicle tracks.

When a vehicle experiences a side skid on a muddy road, the driver should be sober-minded, release the accelerator pedal and at the same time turn the steering wheel to the direction of the rear wheel skidding.
When a vehicle wades across the water, the braking efficiency of the brake does not change.
When discovering a tire is leaking, the driver should firmly hold the steering wheel, ______, do his best to control the driving direction and leave the carriageway as soon as possible.

options.c: Swiftly turning to the other side

question: When a vehicle leaves the main carriageway due to tire leakage, the driver ______ so as not to cause any traffic accident.

options.b: May turn swiftly to the opposite side

question: When a rear tire blows out, the driver should remain calm, _____, do his best to ensure the vehicle goes straight, reduce speed and stop.

options.a: Swiftly turn the steering wheel to adjust
options.b: Firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands
options.c: Swiftly turn the steering wheel to the opposite direction

question: When the driver senses a front tire blows out, he should firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands, _____, and do his best to ensure the vehicle goes straight.

options.b: Stabilize the accelerator pedal in a timely manner

question: If a front tire blows out, it can cause considerable danger. The driver should do his best to control the steering wheel and swiftly _______.

options.b: Immediately shift the gear to the low position

question: If a front tire blowout has caused a turn in direction, the driver should not avoid excess adjustment. Instead, he should control the direction of the vehicle, ____, and slowly reduce the speed of the vehicle.
When a tire blows out while driving, the driver should do his best to ________ to slowly reduce the speed of the vehicle.

options.b: Turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction
options.d: Immediately shift the gear to a low position

question: Before the driver can control the speed of the vehicle that has a tire blowout, he should _______ so that the vehicle will not swing horizontally and cause even greater danger.

options.a: Venture to use the foot brake

question: The emergency measure to deal with a sudden tire blowout on the road is to _______.

options.b: Firmly hold the steering wheel and steadily stop the vehicle as fast as possible
options.c: Swiftly turn the steering wheel to adjust the direction
options.d: Go slowly to find a place for tire change

question: The wrong measure to deal with a sudden tire blowout on the road is to ______.

options.a: Keep calm and slowly release the accelerator pedal
options.b: Firmly hold the steering wheel to ensure the vehicle goes straight
options.c: Apply emergency braking and stop the vehicle in the shortest possible time
options.d: Gently depress the brake pedal after the vehicle slows down

question: When the tire pressure is too low, the fast-running tire can change its shape like waves and increase its temperature, which in turn can cause ________.
The wrong measure to avoid tire blowout is to _________.

options.c: Remove objects from tire tread grooves in a timely manner
options.d: Replace the tire that has cracks or deep cuts

question: When the driver discovers a tire is leaking, he should swiftly brake and reduce speed, steer the vehicle of the carriageway and park it at a safe place on the roadside.

When the driver discovers a tire is leaking and steers the vehicle off the main carriageway, he should refrain from applying emergency so as to avoid a vehicle turnover or a rear-end collision arising from the late braking of the following vehicle.
When a tire on one side blows out on the road (especially on an expressway), the steering wheel will automatically turn violently to the other direction.
A rear tire blowout can sway the tail of the vehicle. The driver should firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands to ensure the vehicle go straight, reduce speed and then stop.
A front tire blowout is very dangerous. The vehicle will immediately turn to the side where the tire is blown out and have a direct impact on the driver's control of the steering wheel.
When the driver senses a tire blowout on the road, he should swiftly depress the brake pedal to reduce speed, do all his can to control the steering wheel and stop the vehicle as soon as possible.

When the driver senses a tire blowout on the road, he should control the direction of the vehicle, gently depress the brake pedal to slowly reduce the speed and gradually park the vehicle steadily on the roadside.
When a tire blows out on the road, the driver should immediately turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction to control the direction of the vehicle.

When a tire blows out suddenly on the road, the driver should refrain from violently depressing the brake pedal in panic. Instead, he should try his best to shift the gear to a low position and use the engine braking to reduce the speed of the vehicle.

After a tire blows out and before the driver can control the speed of the vehicle, he should refrain from using the foot brake to stop the vehicle. Otherwise, a horizontal swing of the vehicle can cause greater danger.
When the vehicle has changed its direction due to a front tire blowout on the road, the driver should firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands to ensure the vehicle goes straight.
When the driver senses a tire blowout on the road, he should control the direction of the vehicle and use emergency braking to bring the vehicle swiftly to a stop.
When the driver discovers that steering is stiff, the wrong measure is to ___________.

options.a: Reduce speed and stop the vehicle as fast as possible

question: When driving a vehicle with power steering, the driver should reduce speed and ______ if he suddenly discovers that steering is difficult.

options.a: Firmly hold the steering wheel to ensure the vehicle goes straight
options.b: Control the steering and drive slowly
options.d: Select a safe place to stop and identify the cause

question: After steering gets out of control, the driver should _____ so that the vehicle can slow down and stop as fast as possible if the vehicle deviates from the straight-going direction.

options.c: Immediately shift the gear to a low position to reduce speed
options.d: Decisively and continuously depress and release the brake pedal

question: When a vehicle deviates from the normal direction due to steering failure and an accident has become unavoidable, the driver should _______ to reduce the impact of vehicle collision.

options.a: Immediately reduce speed and do his best to shorten the stopping distance
options.c: Immediately steer to the side where there is no obstacle and evade
options.d: Immediately steer to the wide where there is obstacle and evade

question: If a fast-running vehicle has a steering failure, using emergency braking can easily cause ________.

options.c: A forward movement of the compartment

question: When driving a vehicle equipped with power steering, the driver should firmly hold the steering wheel and go slowly if he suddenly discovers that steering is difficult.
When the driver discovers that steering suddenly gets stiff but he can still steer, he should slowly drive the vehicle to a nearby workshop for repairs before getting on the road again.
After a sudden steering failure, the driver may not use emergency braking if the vehicle and the road conditions ahead allow the vehicle to go straight.
If a fast-running vehicle has a steering failure, using emergency braking can easily cause an overturn.
When a vehicle suddenly has a steering failure, the driver should immediately depress the brake pedal violently to reduce speed and bring the vehicle to a stop as soon as possible.

When a vehicle has deviated from the straight-going direction and an accident has become unavoidable, the driver should decisively and continuously depress the brake pedal so as to shorten the stopping distance and reduce the impact of vehicle collision.
The road on which the wheels can most easily block when braking is ______.

options.c: Road covered by ice and snow

question: The anti-lock braking system (ABS) can effectively prevent wheel blocking when ______ and can maximize the efficiency of the brake.

When driving a vehicle not equipped with the anti-lock braking system (ABS), the driver should _____ the brake pedal if he brakes on a road covered by ice and snow, a wet and slippery road, a gravel road, or a smooth road.
When there is a braking failure on the road, the driver should keep calm, firmly hold the steering wheel, and ______ to reduce speed.

options.b: Immediately shift the gear to a low position or use the handbrake

question: When there is a braking failure on a downhill road, the drover should not _______.

options.a: Steer the vehicle to the uphill direction
options.b: Use the vehicle body to hit the roadside rocks or trees
options.c: Use the emergency lane to stop the vehicle
options.d: Pull up the handbrake or shift the gear to two positions lower

question: When the driver discovers a vehicle not equipped with anti-lock braking system (ABS) deviates from the normal direction, he should immediately release the brake pedal and depress the pedal again after the direction is in control.
When the driver discovers a vehicle equipped with anti-lock braking system has a braking failure, he should gently depress the brake pedal.
When braking a vehicle equipped with anti-lock braking system (ABS), the driver may depress the brake pedal with force.
When braking a vehicle equipped with anti-lock braking system (ABS), the braking distance does not change.
When there is a sudden braking failure, the driver should evade people first and things second when evading obstacles.
When braking, the steering will become impossible if the front wheels are blocked.
When braking, side skid or tail swing may occur if the rear wheels are blocked.
In order to maximize the braking efficiency, it is unadvisable to pull the handbrake to the full at one stroke.
After a braking failure occurs, the first thing for the driver to do is to control the direction of the vehicle before he manages to control the speed.
When there is a sudden braking failure on a downhill road, the driver may use the front bumper to hit the hill to force the vehicle to a stop if he has no alternative.

After a braking failure, the driver should immediately look for and steer the vehicle to the emergency lane. After the vehicle is stopped, he should pull the handbrake to the full to prevent a second danger arising from sliding.

When there is a braking failure on a downhill road, the driver should immediately shift two gear positions from the high gear to the low gear and use the engine's braking role to control the speed of the vehicle if he has no terrain or opportunity to utilize.

After there is a braking failure on a downhill road, the driver should shift one gear position a time from the high gear to the low gear and use the engine's braking role to control the speed of the vehicle if he has no terrain or opportunity to utilize.
When there is an engine kill on the road, the driver should _________.

options.a: Immediately reduce speed and stop the vehicle
options.c: Place the gear lever in the neutral position and go forward
options.d: Turn on the right-turn signal, slowly sliding the vehicle to the roadside, stop the vehicle and check

question: After the engine stops suddenly and cannot be restarted, the driver should stop at the roadside and identify the cause.
When the engine suddenly stops on the road and cannot be restarted, the driver should apply emergency braking to force the vehicle to stop as fast as possible.
The road surface on which side skidding can most easily occur is _______.

options.d: A road in a heavy rain

question: When a vehicle runs at ______, emergency braking can easily cause side skidding, tail swing or other dangers.

When a vehicle has a side skidding, the driver should immediately ______. At the same time, he should turn the steering wheel in the direction of the side skid and then turn back in good time to adjust. After the vehicle returns to the normal direction, it can continue to go ahead.

options.a: Pull the handbrake to the full

question: When a vehicle skids sideways on a muddy road, the driver should ______.

options.a: Turn the steering wheel in the direction of the side skid to properly adjust the direction
options.b: Turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction of the side skid to properly adjust the direction
options.d: Swiftly brake to stop the vehicle

question: If a vehicle skids sideways due to steering or collision, the driver _______.

options.a: Is not allowed to use the foot brake
options.b: May slowly depress the brake pedal

question: When a vehicle turns at an excessively high speed, it can easily dash out of a curve or skid sideways.
Emergency braking on a muddy or slippery road can easily cause a side skid or even an overturn, fall or collision with other vehicles and the pedestrians.
Turning violently on a muddy or slippery road can easily cause a steering failure, or even an overturn, fall or collision with other vehicles and the pedestrians.
When a vehicle skids sideways, the driver should turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction of the side skid.
When a vehicle skids sideways on a muddy road, the driver should turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction of the side skid.
When a vehicle is likely to have a head-on collision with another vehicle, the driver should first ______ and then swiftly depress the brake pedal.

options.c: Turn slightly to the right side and immediately turn back properly

question: When a vehicle is unavoidably having a head-on collision with another vehicle, the driver should _____ so as to reduce the impact of the head-on collision.

options.c: Immediately turn the steering wheel to the right
options.d: Immediately turn the steering wheel to the left

question: When a collision occurs to the passenger seat side or the impact is relatively small, the wrong measure for the driver is to ________.

options.c: Jump out of the vehicle from one side
options.d: Lean his body backwards against the seat

question: When a vehicle crosses another one, overtakes or evades an obstacle, it can easily scratch another vehicle or other objects. Therefore, the vehicle should increase its horizontal distance with another vehicle.

When a head-on collision is unavoidable, the driver should free the steering wheel, raise the legs and lie sideward on the right seat at the moment of the head-on collision. This can ensure his body is not stuck by the steering wheel.
When a collision is unavoidable, the driver should do his best to avoid side collision.
When a side collision occurs to the side of the driver's seat, the driver should manage to jump out of the vehicle.

When a vehicle has a rear-end collision with the vehicle in front, the driver should lean firmly against the bank of his seat and swiftly put both hand around the back of his head to protect that part.

When a vehicle rolls continuously to a deep ditch, the driver should swiftly hide his body to the lower space in front of his seat, hold ______ to stabilize his body so that his body will not roll and get hurt.
When a vehicle overturns slowly and jumping out of the vehicle is possible, the driver should jump ______.

options.c: In the opposite direction of the overturn

question: The wrong measure when a vehicle suddenly overturns sideways is to _______.

options.a: Tightly hold the steering wheel with both hands
options.b: Hook the pedals with both feet
options.c: Press his back against the seat

question: When sensing an overturn is unavoidable, the driver should do its best to stabilize his body and immediately jump out of the vehicle.
When the driver senses he will inevitably be thrown out of the vehicle, he should violently straighten both his legs to increase the force of being thrown out and jump out of the vehicle.

After jumping out of the vehicle and landing on the ground, the driver should put both his hands around his head and roll in the direction of inertia so as to evade the vehicle and keep off the danger area.
When a vehicle overturns slowly and jumping out of the vehicle is possible, the driver should jump in the direction of the overturn.
When the engine catches fire, the wrong measure is to _____.

options.c: Open the bonnet to extinguish the fire
options.d: Use the fire extinguisher to put out the fire

question: When the fuel of a vehicle catches fire, what cannot be used to put out the fire is __________.
When putting out a fire, the wrong method is to ____________.

options.b: Take off the clothes made of chemical fiber
options.d: Do not breathe through mouth or cry loudly

question: The wrong method to use a fire extinguisher is to _________.

options.b: Stay away from the source of fire as much as possible
options.c: Direct the fire extinguisher at the source of fire
options.d: Direct the fire extinguisher at the flames

question: When a vehicle catches fire, the driver should manage to park the vehicle in an open place far away from the urban areas, buildings, trees, vehicles and inflammable materials, and report the accident and place to the rescue institution.
When a vehicle catches fire on an expressway, the driver should drive the vehicle into the service area or the parking lot to put out the fire.
When the engine catches fire, the driver should immediately cut off the engine and open the bonnet to put out the fire.
Water can be used to put out both the fire on wood, paper, clothes and tires and the fire on electric equipment and gasoline.
When the alcoholic coolant catches fire, the driver may immediately sue water to spray the burning place so as to dilute the alcoholic coolant.
When putting out a fire, the driver should take off the clothes made of chemical fiber and protect the exposed skin.
When putting out a fire, the driver should refrain from breathing through mouth or crying loudly. Otherwise, the fire and smoke will scorch the upper respiratory tract.

When using a fire extinguisher to put out a fire, the person should stand on the windward side, direct the fire extinguisher at the fire and let the wind to blow the bubbles to the source of the fire.
Before the driver escapes from a fire disaster, he should turn off the ignition switch, cut off the power switch and the blind, and manage to turn off the fuel tank switch.
When a running vehicle suddenly falls into water, the driver should __________ to escape.

options.a: Immediately open the door and jump out of the vehicle
options.b: Open the door and swim out after the vehicle stabilizes in water
options.c: Use feet to smash the window and swim out after the vehicle stabilizes in water
options.d: Close the window and make telephone calls for help

question: When a vehicle falls into water, the method that can be selected for self-rescue is ________.
After a vehicle falls into water, the wrong method is ________.

options.c: Allow the water to slowly fill up the compartment

question: When a vehicle falls into water, it is difficult to open the door because of the external water pressure. Therefore the driver should immediately ______ so that he can have the chance to survive.

options.a: Use tools to open the door
options.b: Close the windows to prevent water from flowing into the vehicle
options.d: Open the window or smash the window glass

question: When a vehicle falls into water, the method to escape is to find the direction of the water surface and _________.

options.c: Take measures to prevent water from flowing to the driver's cab
options.d: Open the door or smash the window glass when the driver's cab is full of water

question: After a vehicle falls into water, the wrong method for the driver to rescue himself is to ________.

options.a: Close the window to prevent water from flowing into the vehicle
options.b: Immediately use hand to open the door
options.c: Let the water to fill up the driver's cab so that the water pressure both inside and outside is equal
options.d: Use a large plastic bag to cover the head and tight the neck closely

question: When a vehicle falls into water, the method to survive is to close the doors and windows and wait for the rescue personnel.
After a vehicle falls into water, the driver should keep calm and tell the passengers to be calm, have deep breath and open the doors or windows to escape when water nearly fills up the compartment.

When a vehicle falls into water, the driver should in no way panic. In particular, those who cannot swim should first manage to escape through the windows. As long as they reach the water surface, they will have more chances to survive.

When it is difficult to open the door because of the external water pressure, the driver should take all possible measures to prevent water from flowing into the compartment so that he can have a chance to survive.

After a vehicle falls into water, the driver should immediately close the windows to prevent water from flowing into the compartment and to keep the air from flowing out. At the same time, they make telephone calls to tell the rescue personnel the place of the accident and wait for their arrival.
A motor vehicle mainly comprises four parts: engine, chassis, body and ____.
When the engine coolant is unable to circulate, the engine will _______.
The pressure indicated by the engine oil pressure meter represents the engine oil pressure of the __________ of the engine.

options.c: Fuel inlet pipe of the engine oil pump

question: The main role of the engine lubrication system is _______.
The power of the engine is transmitted to _____ through the clutch, gearbox and transmission shaft.
If the braking device works only on one of the front wheels when braking is applied, it will cause _______ to the motor vehicle and can very easily cause an accident.
The steering wheel designed to control the direction of the vehicle is used to control ____to change the direction of the vehicle.
The clutch pedal designed to control the clutch is used to control the power connection and separation between _______ and the transmission system.
The brake pedal designed to control ______ is used to reduce speed or stop a vehicle.
The accelerator pedal designed to control ____ of the engine or oil pump plunger is used to control the rotation speed of the engine.
The gear lever designed to control _____ is used to change the speed, torque and direction of a vehicle.
A motor vehicle comprises four basic parts: engine, chassis, ignition system and body.
The ignition system is made up of battery, ignition switch, ignition coil, capacitor, distributor block and plugs.
The gear is designed to smoothly connect and completely separate the engine and the transmission system for starting to move and changing gear.
The foot brake is designed to keep a stopped vehicle from moving.
Depressing the accelerator pedal reduces the rotation speed of the engine and releasing the pedal increases the rotation speed of the engine.
Depressing the clutch pedal connects the clutch, and releasing the pedal separates the clutch.
When the brake pedal is depressed, the handbrake works.
The speedometer comprises two parts: speed meter and mileage meter. The speed meter indicates _______.

options.c: The rotation speed of the engine

question: The engine oil pressure meter is used to indicate the pressure of the lubrication oil in the main oil pipe of the ______ when the engine works.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on or blinks while a vehicle is on the road, it indicates _______.

options.c: The oil way may be in trouble

question: When the "" light on the dashboard is on while a vehicle is on the road, it reminds the driver he should________.

options.a: Send the vehicle to the service station
options.d: Identify the trouble of the oil way

question: When the "" light on the dashboard is always on, it indicates that the driver and the passengers ______.

options.d: The safety belts are too loose

question: When "" light on the dashboard is on while a vehicle is on the road, it indicates ______.

options.a: The temperature in the vehicle is too high
options.b: The engine temperature is too low
options.c: The fuel temperature is too high
options.d: The engine temperature is too high or the coolant is insufficient

question: When the "" light on the dashboard is on while a vehicle is on the road, it indicates ______.

options.a: The engine oil is insufficient and its pressure is too low
options.d: The engine oil is too much and its pressure is too high

question: When the "" light on the dashboard is on, it reminds the driver he is using ______. A The low beam light B. The high beam light C. The head fog light D. The tail fog light
The safety pillow of the chair is mainly designed to ______.

options.a: Relax the head when the vehicle is on the road
options.b: Protect the neck when there is a rear-end collision
options.c: Maintain the correct posture when there is a rear-end collision
options.d: Relax the neck during a long journey

question: The height of the pillow of the chair should be adjusted so that the center of the pillow _______.

options.b: Is at the same level of the neck
options.c: Is at the same level of the head

question: Before driving a vehicle to a road, the driver should buckled up, the main aim being to _________.

options.a: Avoid the punishment of the administrative department
options.c: Force the back against the chair
options.d: Effectively protect the body when there is a collision or emergency braking

question: When a vehicle equipped with safety bags is on the road, the passenger in the front seat _______.

options.c: May or may not buckled up
options.d: Should use the hand to hold the safety belt

question: When the driver adjusts his seat, he should adjust it _____.

options.a: So that the tips of his straightened hands can reach the top of the steering wheel
options.b: So that the writs of his straightened hands can reach beyond the top of the steering wheel
options.c: So that he can easily depress the accelerator pedal to the floor
options.d: So that he can easily depress the clutch and brake pedals to the floor

question: Before driving a vehicle out, the driver should check whether the steering, lighting and ______ work well.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on or blinks while a vehicle is on the road, the driver may continue to go forward if he fails to discover anything abnormal for the time being.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on or blinks while a vehicle is on the road, it indicates that the braking system is abnormal.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on while a vehicle is on the road, it reminds the driver he needs to add engine oil.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on, it indicates the safety belt is not properly buckled up.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on, it reminds the driver that his seat is not properly adjusted.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on while a vehicle is on the road, it indicates the temperature in the vehicle is abnormal.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on while a vehicle is on the road, it indicates the engine oil could be insufficient and the engine oil pressure is too low.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on, it indicates that the low beam light is on.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on, it indicates the fog light is on.
When driving a vehicle equipped with air bags, the driver should buckle up.
When driving a vehicle equipped with air bags, the driver does not need to buckle up.
When the "" light on the dashboard is on, it indicates the low beam light is on.
Routine vehicle maintenance mainly comprises cleaning, re-supply and _____.
Before driving a vehicle, the driver should check and see whether the steering, tires, lighting and ____ work well.
The maximum free adjustment angle of the steering wheel of a motor vehicle is no more than ________.
The routine inspection and maintenance of the engine compartment should include _______.

options.c: Quantities of engine oil, coolant and braking liquid

question: When checking the engine oil, it is necessary to put the vehicle on a level place and do it ______.

options.a: Immediately after the engine is turned off
options.d: Before the cool engine is started up or 30 minutes after the engine is turned off.

question: When stopping on the way, it is necessary to check to see whether there is a water, ___ or gas leakage.
During a routine vehicle maintenance, it is necessary to check whether the tire pressure is normal, whether there is any cut in the tire, and whether _________.

options.a: A new tire should be replaced
options.d: The objects in the tire tread grooves should be removed

question: When checking a tire, the depth from the tire surface to the bottom of the tread groove should not be less than ______. Otherwise, the tire should be replaced.
Using a cracked or damaged tire on the road can easily cause _______.
The wrong method to use a special spare tire is to _______.

options.a: Use it as a normal tire for a long time
options.b: Use it temporarily after a tire blowout
options.c: Use it temporarily when a tire is leaking
options.d: It cannot be used as a normal tire

question: A pre-driving checking should cover the driver's cab, the engine compartment, the exterior of the vehicle and the tires.
When checking the clutch pedal, it is necessary to depress the pedal to the floor to see if the space between the pedal and the floor is proper.
When checking the windscreen wiper, it is preferably done when it is dry.
The pre-driving checking of the engine compartment should cover the windscreen wash, engine oil, coolant, battery liquid and fan belt.

To avoid a tire blowout, it is necessary to regularly check whether the tire pressure conforms to the standard and whether the exterior of the vehicle is damaged and to remove the objects in the tread grooves of the tires.
To avoid a tire blowout, it is necessary to regularly rotate the tires and properly reduce the tire pressure.
The special spare tire can only be used temporarily when a tire is leaking or a tire blows out.
The special spare tire can both be used temporarily when a tire is leaking or a tire blows out and also used as a normal tire.
A tire whose pressure is higher or lower than the standard can cause a tire blowout.
Using a cracked or damaged tire on the road can easily cause a tire blowout.
When rescuing the injured, it is necessary to ________.

options.a: Save life first and treat the wounds later
options.b: Treat the wounds first and safe life later
options.c: Help the slightly wounded persons first
options.d: Help the seriously wounded persons later

question: When a wounded person is under the wheel or cargo, the wrong method is to ______.

options.c: Pull the limbs of the wounded

question: When there many wounded persons in an extremely serious accident who need to be sent to hospital, the persons ______ should be the first to be sent.
When there many wounded persons, those who should be sent to hospital last are the persons ________.

options.d: Whose intestines and veins are exposed

question: When carrying the wounded persons in coma or in danger of suffocation, they should lie _______.

options.d: On their side and face down

question: When rescuing the persons who are losing blood, it is necessary to ______ first.
The wrong measure to rescue a person sustaining burns all over his body is to _________.

options.b: Swiftly put out the flames of his clothes
options.c: Spray cool water to his body

question: The first-aid measure to rescue a poisoned person is to _______.

options.b: Bring him to a place where air is fresh
options.d: Depress the heart over the chest

question: When using splints, sticks or tree branches to keep the unexposed bones in position, it is necessary that these things should _________.

options.a: Exceed the upper and lower joints of the wound
options.b: Exceed the lower joint of the wound
options.c: Exceed the upper joint of the wound
options.d: Not exceed the upper and lower joints of the wound

question: The person suffering joint injury (sprain, dislocation or fracture) __________.

options.a: Is allowed to change the location at the moment of being wounded
options.c: Should try to reset the dislocation
options.d: May properly adjust the posture at the moment of being wounded

question: When the wounded person suffering main artery bleeding, the bleeding can be stopped by pressing the thumb on the artery ________ to stop the pulse of the artery and stop the bleeding.

options.d: In the center of the wound

question: The method to press the general neck artery to stop bleeding is usually used to the wounded person who suffers ______ artery bleeding when other bleeding-stopping methods do not work.
When there is a bleeding in an upper limb or shank without bone fracture or joint damage, the bleeding can be stopped by __________.
The article that cannot be used to stop bleeding by dressing is _________.
Stopping bleeding with tourniquet refers to ligating an elastic rubber tube and rubber band at ________ of the upper limb or the middle thigh of the wounded person.
When rescuing a wounded person suffering spinal fracture, it is necessary to ___________.

options.c: Use sling to keep in position
options.d: Help the wounded person to move

question: The wrong method to rescue a wounded person suffering spinal fracture is to ______.

options.c: Refrain from helping the wounded person to walk
options.d: Use a soft stretcher to carry

question: When a wounded person is under the wheel of the vehicle or the cargo, it is necessary to pull him out as soon as possible.
When a wounded person is unable to get off the vehicle by himself, he should be removed from the vehicle so as to avoid a secondary injury.
The wounded person who is losing blood can be treated by exerting external pressure to stop the bleeding and put on a bandage.
When rescuing a wounded person in coma, it is necessary to take warm-keeping measures to prevent heat loss.
When a wounded person suffering burns is thirsty, he may drink a small quantity of slightly salty water.
When rescuing a wounded person who has been poisoned by toxic gas, the first measure is to send him to a place where air is fresh so that he will not continue to be poisoned.
When removing a wounded person suffering spinal fracture, the rescuer should never help the wounded person to walk. He may be carried away with a soft stretcher.
When there is bleeding at the bone fracture of a wounded person, the first thing to do is to keep it in position before stopping the bleeding and dress the wound.
When a wounded person suffering bone fracture in the thigh, shank and spine, it is necessary to keep the fracture in position and refrain to move the wounded person.
When putting a bone fracture in position, the fixing should be proper and solid. Both the two fractured parts and the upper and lower joints should be fixed.
When putting a bone fracture in the upper limb in position, the limb must be straightened and tied up.
When putting a bone fracture in the lower limb, the limb must be crooked and tied up.
When the bone of a wounded person suffering bone fracture is exposed, it is necessary to put it in position and tie it up.
When carrying a wounded person suffering bone fracture onto a stretcher, two rescuers should put their hands under the wounded person and carry him together onto the stretcher.
When the spine of a wounded person suffering bone fracture could be damaged, the rescuers should refrain from changing his posture.
If a wounded person is breathless, it is necessary to immediately conduct mouth-to-mouth artificial respiration.
When rescuing a wounded person in an emergency, it is necessary to firstly stop the bleeding by compression before other methods are taken according to the conditions of bleeding.
When using tourniquet to stop the bleeding of a wounded person, the rescuer must make sure it is tightly bonded. Otherwise, bleeding will continue in the deeper artery.
When a wounded suffers bleeding in the forearm or shank, the rescuers may place a cushion in the armpit or in the rook of the arm, crook the armpit or rook and tie up.
When using a bondage to dress a wounded person, the knot should be made neither above the wound nor at the back of the body. Otherwise, the wounded person will feel uncomfortable when sleeping.
When there is no bondage for rescuing a wounded person, towels, handkerchiefs, bed sheets and stockings can be used for dressing.
When there is a bleeding in the upper limb of a wounded person but he suffers no bone fracture or joint damage, the bleeding can be stopped by pressurized dressing.
When there is a bleeding in the bone fracture of a wounded person, the fractured bone should be put into position before stopping the bleeding and sterilizing and dressing the wound.
refers to the material and article that has the danger of overall explosion.
Gun powder, explosives and detonating powder are ________.
Matches, sulfur and red phosphorus are _________.
_____ of the following are a dangerous inflammable solid material.
Dangerous chemicals possess the characteristics of explosion, inflammation, poison, erosion and radiation.
When compressed gas is likely to burn or explode, it is necessary to cover the cylinder with sandy soil and remove it from the danger area.
Once inflammable gas causes a fire disaster, it should be put out with water in good time.
When an erosive material catches fire, it should be put out with water cannon.
When putting out a fire disaster that gives out erosive steam or poisonous gas, the firefighters should wear gas masks and other related protective articles and should operate from the windward side.
